comment._content: Great shot of my home from the late 1950s to mid 1970s.  My parents owned The Weather Vane until my brother, sister, and I sold it after our mother, June Lesch, died. The window above the store was my father's Harbormaster office after my brother moved out. My father Gene C. "Shorty" Lesch had an excellent view from the upstairs window of Motif # 1 and T-Wharf. It was great place to watch the people go by when I was little. My mother used the office after my father died as a "sun room" as it faced South East.  Another person rented the gift shop selling fine clothing and sweaters. This woman lost her husband on 9/11 aboard United Airlines Flight 175.

I have a wonderful mid-century (1967) -modern pewter bowl made, signed and dated by your father. It is really fascinating to read about the life of the man who made it, and to see the shop where the bowl most probably came from.

It sounds like he was a true artist of life.
